name: Valentine's Salmon
description: This really produces a fantastic piece of salmon, and when paired with a simple potato and leek chowder, would make a terrific Valentine's dinner idea.
recipeIngredient: 1 leek, white and tender green parts only, halved lengthwise and sliced
1 ½ cups diced Yukon Gold potatoes
3 cups water, or more as needed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons Asian chili paste (sambal), or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add 8 green onions and cook uncovered until slightly softened, about 30 seconds. Immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes until cold to stop the cooking process. Once the onions are cold, drain well, and set aside.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-low heat until browned, about 8 minutes. Stir in garlic, leek, salt, and butter; cook and stir until leek is softened, about 10 minutes. Add potatoes and enough water to cover, about 3 cups. Season with salt and cayenne pepper. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low and cook until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking dish with parchment paper lightly coated with vegetable oil.

Prepare each salmon filet salmon by cutting the belly, the bottom 1/3 of the fillet, off the skin. Cut remaining 2/3 of fillet away from skin. Cut this piece in half. Cut belly in half horizontally. Spread each piece with tarragon mustard and top with a slice salmon belly. Season with salt and black pepper. Wrap each salmon packet with two green onions, crisscrossing like ribbons, tucking the ends on the underside.
Place salmon packets, belly-side up, on the parchment and drizzle each with vegetable oil.
Bake in the preheated oven until the salmon is slightly firm to the touch and no longer translucent inside, about 15 minutes.
Heat potato leek soup and stir in chopped green onion. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve soup in shallow bowls, topped with 1 salmon packet and garnished with chili paste.

review.reviewBody: Made this for my wife and she flipped. Requesting this recipe once a month now. Don't make the mistake I did -- found the chowder very bland while cooking added chicken stock and punched up the seasoning. It didn't need it. Once the salmon is put together with the soup chili paste... it all comes together. Go AS IS!

Made this for my husband on Valentine's Day and he loved it! I used Dijon mustard between the layers of salmon as suggested in the video. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly as written. The video was very helpful. Thanks for such a great dish!
sorry but this recipe is to complicated and confusing for me. i didn't finish it. i also was missing the cream in the chowder
My Valentine and I shared this cooking experience and it was lovely!!!!!!!! Directions and video were perfect and humorous....would try anything by Chef John.

Love Chief John...I do not consider myself a cook, he builds myself confidence with humor. Ok now the recipe... On our monthly rotation now, even my 16 year old loved it...For the most part, I followed recipe, tweaked it on my family's preference.
1. Dijon mustard and a tad of honey mixed in... 
(never heard of what mustard he used, I'm sure it would be great, ...interest to hear about others reviewers about their other suggestions between the layers) 
2. Potatoes... 2 cups... or 2 large (3 small). Potatoes 
3. MORE bacon per our fam. members... Love of bacon., maple bacon large slice,one slice per fam. 
(Remember, just make sure you drain out the majority of bacon fat.,before adding other ingredients)
4. I skipped the pan warm up on stove top...cooked for 20 min at 375 degrees. 
5. We salted and pepper the whole thing per our individual taste
6. I served chili sauce, on the side, for husband preference
(chili paste...in  supermarket found in the herb section... Gourmet "fresh" in a tube)
7. Didn't find the video confusing, but helpful, viewed it once all the way, then stopped it and started it as I was working on cooking it, that also helps me build my confidence.
Ps the time to make and finish is spot on

Watching the video did help with this a lot.  Cutting the salmon was not difficult however the "Belly Piece I had was too thin to butterfly, so I had to make some adjustments.  I also went very light with the Lemon Tarragon mustard, next time I would use more.  All in all a fairly simple recipe that did deliver a nice dinner!
This was absolutely delicious will definitely have it again

I made no changes to the recipe. This was outstanding. I will make it again as my wife now request it frequently. If you want to make a fairly easy recipe that look like a complicated work of art and taste amazing this the one for you.
